p.strong: As one of Indiana’s largest school districts, Indianapolis Public Schools is committed to academic excellence built through individualized, relationship-based learning. Our students are empowered to think critically, creatively and responsibly, to embrace diversity and pursue their dreams with purpose.

h3.a: April Board Meeting Will be Livestreamed Due to COVID-19

div.div: Due to COVID-19 guidance from state and local public health officials with regard to minimizing the risk of community spread of the Coronavirus, the Indianapolis Public Schools Board of School Commissioners has made several changes to the April Board meeting. The Agenda Review Session, scheduled for Tuesday, April 28, was cancelled. The Board Action Session scheduled for Thursday, April […]

h3.a: Short-Term Internet Connectivity – Marion County Schools

div.div: Provider Coverage Area Estimated Set-Up Time For Customers Additional Service Information AT&T All of Marion County Turnaround time is variable depending on whether the customer applies online or by phone, how quickly the customer provides documentation that they are qualified (participation in SNAP, National School Lunch Program, Head Start etc.), and variations in installation workload […]

h3.a: Broadcast of IPS K–8 Lessons April 27 – June 4

div.div: Indianapolis Public Schools (IPS) and Circle City Broadcasting, owner of WISH-TV and MyINDY-TV 23, have formed a partnership to broadcast academic lessons to IPS students in Grades K–8 five days a week.

h3.a: IPS and Circle City Broadcasting Partner to Broadcast K–8 Lessons to Students

div.div: Indianapolis Public Schools (IPS) and Circle City Broadcasting, owner of WISH-TV and MyINDY-TV 23, have formed a partnership to broadcast academic lessons to IPS students in Grades K–8 five days a week. The lessons will start airing from 8 a.m. to 10 a.m. Monday–Friday on MyINDY-TV 23, beginning April 27. Each lesson will vary in […]

h3.a: IPS Foundation Launches the IPS Education Equity Fund To Meet the Social, Emotional and Academic Needs of Students

div.div: Indianapolis Public Schools (IPS) is proactively working to ensure that the inequities its students face daily – in the community, at home and in the classroom – don’t continue into the 2020-21 school year, even in the midst of current school closures due to the Coronavirus (COVID-19). In a district where 65 percent of students […]

div.p:
Due to COVID-19, the IPS Board of School Commissioners has made several changes to the April Board meeting.
The Board Action Session Thursday will be held virtually and livestreamed. Follow the link below for more info.
👉 https://myips.org/blog/district/april-board-meeting-will-be-livestreamed-due-to-covid-19/

Looking for information on temporary internet access options from local providers? Please follow the link below for area coverage, service times and additional service info.
👉 https://myips.org/blog/district/short-term-internet-connectivity-marion-county-schools/

Superintendent @AleesiaLJohnson is proud to support efforts to secure funding for school districts through the next coronavirus appropriations bill.
#StrongerTogetherIPS

a.p: In a letter to Congress, the Council and 62 urban school district superintendents work to secure funding for local school systems in the next coronavirus supplemental appropriations bill. Letter to Congress: https://tinyurl.com/ycxaxx7w Press Release: https://tinyurl.com/y9mdclgx

div.p:
The #myips Choice Application Lottery runs until April 30. If you’re interested in enrolling your child in an IPS Choice school or program, you must use the Choice Application Lottery. Are you ready to choose IPS?
Learn More👉 https://ipsnewsroom.org/the-ips-choice-application-lottery-opens-november-1/
